column4: can you help me i have the same problem with video driver i installed the driver from command line but not work my system starts with comand line ?
now i cant start ubuntu in safe mode
why my system cant start withowt video driver ?
What driver did you install and what card do you have?
Ick. You should have used sys>admin>additional drivers applet to install the nvidia driver
Try booting to CLI then 'rm -rf /etc/X11/xorg.conf' then reboot
i know bit i cant start my sistem it starts with comand line
Try booting to CLI (CLI = Command Line Interface) then 'rm -rf /etc/X11/xorg.conf' then reboot
I already told you what to try
If you can't follow any instruction, no one will be able to help you
> i tryed that comand and not work , any ideas?
Perhaps you should try undoing what you did with apt-get remove --purge *nvidia*
The nvidia module is loading and apparently, it's broken
Try creating /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-nvidia and put nvidia on a single line in it
sudo nano /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-nvidia, then type nvidia and press Ctrl+X, then hit Y and enter
Yes, you can mount the root filesystem and create the file
Are you sure you created it on the filesystem on the hard drive and not on the live session file system?
Sounds like it could be a problem with your webcam driver initialization routine </guess>
Try filing a bug report
Have you tried running the applications from terminal to see if there's any interesting output?
Sure, just have it reload the module
